The Billings School District will be live-streaming our 2020 Graduation Ceremony on Facebook, today, June 25th at 2:00 pm. Please join us as we celebrate our Seniors!

Click the link on our main page or click here to go to the Billings School Facebook page: https://m.facebook.com/pages/category/Elementary-School/Billings-R-IV-School-494347727618456/

post_text: Preschool and new incoming kindergarten screenings will be June 29th-30th. Please contact the elementary office at 417-744-2552 to schedule an appointment.
text: Preschool and new incoming kindergarten screenings will be June 29th-30th. Please contact the elementary office at 417-744-2552 to schedule an appointment.

post_text: We are fortunate to have another delivery of extra food from the Convoy of Hope in Springfield, coming from Farmers to Families Food Box Program. Many of you have asked about additional milk. This delivery includes 1 pallet of milk and 9 pallets of fruit and veggies, approximately 600 boxes. No large bags of onions that I know of.ðŸ˜‚The food is scheduled to be here at 2:00 pm today, and we will hand it out at the same place, behind the school kitchen until 6:00 this evening. I will keep you posted if food is also available tomorrow. Please come pick up some of the free food, as we do not want it to go to waste. Thank you!

This delivery includes 1 pallet of milk and 9 pallets of fruit and veggies, approximately 600 boxes. No large bags of onions that I know of.ðŸ˜‚The food is scheduled to be here at 2:00 pm today, and we will hand it out at the same place, behind the school kitchen until 6:00 this evening. I will keep you posted if food is also available tomorrow. Please come pick up some of the free food, as we do not want it to go to waste. Thank you!

post_text:
Dear Billings Community,

I was approached with a wonderful opportunity today to accept a delivery from the Convoy of Hope, with food items from the USDA Farmers to Families Food Box Program. These items include half-gallons of 2% milk, boxes of fruits and veggies, boxes of individually packed cinnamon rolls, bottles of tea, and onions. The food is free and available to anyone who can use it. We will be here at the school tomorrow from 8:00 am to noon, outside the cafeteria, behind the school on Mt. Vernon. If you can use the food, but cannot get here and pick it up yourself, please call me and I will do my best to deliver it to you. Hope to see you tomorrow! If you have any questions, you can call me on my cell, 417-838-4609.

Thank you,

Mrs. Brandt
text:

The food is free and available to anyone who can use it. We will be here at the school tomorrow from 8:00 am to noon, outside the cafeteria, behind the school on Mt. Vernon. If you can use the food, but cannot get here and pick it up yourself, please call me and I will do my best to deliver it to you. Hope to see you tomorrow! If you have any questions, you can call me on my cell, 417-838-4609.

Thank you,

Mrs. Brandt

post_text: Just a reminder-The Billings FEMA Building will be open during a tornado warning. Due to COVID-19, set protocol will be followed. Be prepared to sign in, check your temperature, and to keep the appropriate distance from others, should we have a tornado warning this evening or in the near future.

post_text: The Billings School will have educational packets ready for K-6 students, and JH/HS students without internet access on Friday, April 10th, from 8-12:00 and on Monday from 8-3:00 pm. You may line up at the main central office doors and we will bring them out to your car.

post_text: Missouri schools are ordered to close for the remainder of the academic year, according to Gov. Mike Parson. The Billings School will be closed for the remainder of the school year, but will continue with the delivery of instruction, meals to children, and other related services to the best of our ability. Watch our website at www.billings.k12.mo.us for additional information.

post_text:
March 30, 2020-Faculty/Administration Zoom meeting to discuss changes in delivery of instruction for Preschool-12th grade students.

With the extended closure, we will be sending one Chrome Book home to each of our families for their students to use on assignments and enrichment activities. Paper packets will be delivered by Administration, on buses Friday, to the Preschool-6th grade homes, and to those families without internet. Junior High and High School students with internet access will receive instruction through Google Classroom.They will receive an invitation to join.

Chrome Books will be available to pick up for all grade levels on Saturday from 9:00-12:00 pm. A parent must be present to sign the release form. Remember one per family. If you cannot pick up your Chrome Book on Saturday, send an email to brandtc@billings.k12.mo.us, and we can arrange to have it delivered. Our goal is to provide online enrichment activities as well as lessons more specialized to our students and classes.
text:
March 30, 2020-Faculty/Administration Zoom meeting to discuss changes in delivery of instruction for Preschool-12th grade students.

With the extended closure, we will be sending one Chrome Book home to each of our families for their students to use on assignments and enrichment activities. Paper packets will be delivered by Administration, on buses Friday, to the Preschool-6th grade homes, and to those families without internet. Junior High and High School students with internet access will receive instruction through Google Classroom.They will receive an invitation to join.

Chrome Books will be available to pick up for all grade levels on Saturday from 9:00-12:00 pm. A parent must be present to sign the release form. Remember one per family. If you cannot pick up your Chrome Book on Saturday, send an email to brandtc@billings.k12.mo.us, and we can arrange to have it delivered. Our goal is to provide online enrichment activities as well as lessons more specialized to our students and classes.

post_text: Thursday, March 26, 2020-Extended Closure for the Billings R-IV School District. The Billings R-IV School District announces they will remain closed through April 24, 2020.
text: Thursday, March 26, 2020-Extended Closure for the Billings R-IV School District. The Billings R-IV School District announces they will remain closed through April 24, 2020.

post_text: Just a reminder, the Billings School will have paper learning packets ready tomorrow at 8:00 am for all children. This first packet is for one week. All children, PK-12, are to return them by the end of the wellness break, April 6th. Additional packets will follow. We will keep you posted, if online lessons become an available option. For the pick-up lane, please line up in your car, in front of the main central office doors, and we will run the packets out to your car. If you do not pick up your packets from 8:00-3:00 pm Tuesday, March 24th, they will be delivered to you. Also, until further notice, free meals for children under 18 will be available each day in the back of the school cafeteria from 11:00-12:00 pm. If you have medications in Nurse Dawn's office that you need, please let her know by email, text or phone call, and she will bring them down tomorrow for you to pick up at the central office line. Thank you for your patience and understanding. We love and appreciate you so much!-Mrs. Brandt
text: Just a reminder, the Billings School will have paper learning packets ready tomorrow at 8:00 am for all children. This first packet is for one week. All children, PK-12, are to return them by the end of the wellness break, April 6th. Additional packets will follow. We will keep you posted, if online lessons become an available option. For the pick-up lane, please line up in your car, in front of the main central office doors, and we will run the packets out to your car. If you do not pick up your packets from 8:00-3:00 pm Tuesday, March 24th, they will be delivered to you. Also, until further notice, free meals for children under 18 will be available each day in the back of the school cafeteria from 11:00-12:00 pm. If you have medications in Nurse Dawn's office that you need, please let her know by email, text or phone call, and she will bring them down tomorrow for you to pick up at the central office line. Thank you for your patience and understanding. We love and appreciate you so much!-Mrs. Brandt

post_text: March 18, 2020-PROM NEWS-Due to current circumstances, PROM has been rescheduled for May 9th, at the Tower Club.
text: March 18, 2020-PROM NEWS-Due to current circumstances, PROM has been rescheduled for May 9th, at the Tower Club.

post_text:
The Billings School will be providing meals from 11:00 am-12:00 pm, starting today. The location for pick-up is the back cafeteria doors, off of Mt. Vernon. You do not have to get out of your car. Meals are free to children under 18. Per program protocol, children should be present to get the meal, as we are required to keep count documentation.

Just a reminder, if you have circumstances where you cannot pick up the meals, you may call the central office at 417-744-2623 for delivery prior. You will need to give us your name and address for delivery and the days you want food delivered. Deliveries will be made between 11:00 am-12:30 pm.
text:
The Billings School will be providing meals from 11:00 am-12:00 pm, starting today. The location for pick-up is the back cafeteria doors, off of Mt. Vernon. You do not have to get out of your car. Meals are free to children under 18. Per program protocol, children should be present to get the meal, as we are required to keep count documentation.

Just a reminder, if you have circumstances where you cannot pick up the meals, you may call the central office at 417-744-2623 for delivery prior. You will need to give us your name and address for delivery and the days you want food delivered. Deliveries will be made between 11:00 am-12:30 pm.

post_text: All updates from Superintendent Brandt are located on the homepage of our website at www.billings.k12.mo.us, under "Superintendent's Updates". If you scroll down you can revisit all information presented on COVID-19. The newest information will be located at the bottom. Dates are provided. You will also see the answers to some of your questions. Please check the website often for new information. Thank you for your patience and support as we go though these unusual circumstances.

post_text: The Billings School in conjunction with other area school districts is going on a Wellness Break starting Tuesday, March 17th through Friday, April 3rd. Information will be posted and updated on our website at www.billings.k12.mo.us. Thank you for your patience and support as we try to keep our students families, faculty and staff as safe as possible.

post_text: The Billings Board of Education approved the 4 Day School Week for the 2020-2021 school year at the March 9, 2020 special board meeting.
text: The Billings Board of Education approved the 4 Day School Week for the 2020-2021 school year at the March 9, 2020 special board meeting.

post_text:
The Billings R-IV School District invites you to participate in this second 4 Day School Week Survey. We value your opinion and appreciate your participation!

Please click below to take the survey:
https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/VJT8JKX

post_text: The City of Billings is currently making a repair to a leak in the water line in front of the school. During this repair yesterday we had the water near the concession stand, lobby restrooms and front area turned off for a brief time. Students had water and access to all other restrooms and we were able to operate as normal. Thank you to the City of Billings for quick repair and for taking such good care of the school!
text: The City of Billings is currently making a repair to a leak in the water line in front of the school. During this repair yesterday we had the water near the concession stand, lobby restrooms and front area turned off for a brief time. Students had water and access to all other restrooms and we were able to operate as normal. Thank you to the City of Billings for quick repair and for taking such good care of the school!

post_text: The next 4 Day School Week Public Informational Meeting has been moved to Thursday, February 20th, at 6:00 pm in the FEMA Building. This is an informational meeting, and no decisions have been made. We hope you can join us!
text: The next 4 Day School Week Public Informational Meeting has been moved to Thursday, February 20th, at 6:00 pm in the FEMA Building. This is an informational meeting, and no decisions have been made. We hope you can join us!

post_text: Due to the number of students absent today with flu symptoms, we have decided to dismiss at 1:00 pm and will not be in session tomorrow, February 18, 2020. We will be doing a thorough cleaning of the facility. No practices or activities today.
text: Due to the number of students absent today with flu symptoms, we have decided to dismiss at 1:00 pm and will not be in session tomorrow, February 18, 2020. We will be doing a thorough cleaning of the facility. No practices or activities today.

post_text: The Billings School is closed today, due to the weather. We will make a decision on activities later today and post that information on the school website at www.billings.k12.mo.us.

post_text: The Billings School will be closed Friday, January 17, 2020, due to the weather forecast.

You are invited to our Veterans Day Celebration!
Date: Monday, November 11, 2019, Location: High School Gymnasium, Time: 9:00 am. The Billings K-12 students will be performing and a lunch will be served to our Veterans in the FEMA building after the assembly. Please join us as we honor our local Veterans!

post_text: Congratulations to the Lady Wildcats! The Billings Varsity Volleyball Team will be traveling to Cape Girardeau on Thursday for the State Championship. Their schedule on Friday will be 10:00-Wildcats v Calvary Lutheran, 12:00-Wildcats v Santa Fe, and 2:00-Wildcats v Advance. The finals will be Saturday at 12:00 third place, or 1:30 Championship match. There will be no school on Friday in support of our students. Many students and parents will be attending the games on Friday and Saturday. Our make-up day will be January 20, 2020. We are very proud of our Lady Wildcats! Go Wildcats!

post_text: The Billings School experienced a power outage just as notifications were being sent out, which included phone service. We held back dismissal until the rain let up. Buses will be delayed. Safety is our first priority. Thank you for your patience and support!

post_text: The Billings Community Night at the Cardinals has been canceled, due to the weather. As of now the game there has not been called. We have been assured that we can reschedule the entire recognition of the Band, Volleyball, and Cheer, but this will require an exchange of tickets to Ms. Waldo. If you attend the game this evening, you will be required to purchase new tickets to attend the rescheduled date. Ms. Waldo will have details early next week. As always, safety is our #1 priority. Thank you for your support!

The Billings School is in session today, Tuesday, February 6th. The road conditions have improved overnight. We will be monitoring the weather today, as the National Weather Service is anticipating precipitation in the SW area between 2-5 pm.
There is a possibility for an early release and/or cancellation of after school activities if the precipitation moves in early today. Please watch the website, school messenger and the news for further information.
